text: Person1: What do you think the Board is going to say when I tell them that? Person2: I don't care. Person1: With all due respect, you damn well better care because if you try to stonewall them again, there'll be blood on the floor.

Person1: Only till they get you into the local school. Person2: With Mrs. Evans. I hate her. Person1: You'll be at home for the weekends. Now shut up, or walk.

Person1: We've got to stick together, Sam. You've got to help me. Person2: What about Mom? Person1: No!  We can't tell Mom!  Please, Sam.  Don't tell her. Person2: I don't know, Michael.  This is not like breaking a lamp or getting a 'D'. Person1: Just for a few days, Sam.  Give me a chance to work this out by myself.
Person1: This is your problem, right here. This girl's driving you insane, Ethan. Let me help you. Person2: I don't want your help. Person1: Come back to my house. My car's outside.

Person1: Sir Robert tried to deal with the kidnapping with his own...resources, at first. When Elektras ear was delivered to him in the post, he came to me.  I advised against paying the ransom. I knew it was Renard. I played it out as long as possible to get a fix on him. Person2: Sacrifice the girl to take out the terrorist? Person1: How many deaths is he responsible for? How many innocent people? You may only get one shot at a man like Renard. Same circumstances, Id do the same again.
Person1: Commander, I have to log it... Person2: That's a direct order. You didn't see a thing!
movie: austin powers: international man of mystery

text: Person1: Listen, Niki. My daughter's been missing five months. I've gone through a lot to find out what's happened to her. I just saw a girl killed. I will not let Tod slip out of my hands. You have to tell me where he is. Person2: But then you'll forget about me. Person1: Where is he, Niki?
Person1: I'm not a murderer, Mr. McKenna. Person2: How do you know if you've never tried? Person1: This is a joke, right?  You just want to rattle me.  Right?
Person1: What happens if I can't catch him? Person2: If Sid 6.7 hasn't killed you, we throw you back in here and you serve out the rest of your sentence. Person1: How do you know I won't run?

Person1: Ssh. Don't want babe to hear. Person2: You're hurting. Person1: You won't cheat me will you? You'll stay with me. Help me. Then we can be together, the way we were before. We belong to each other now, for better or worse...

Person1: When I thought about you I was mostly hating you. Where've you been hiding? Person2: I haven't been hiding. I've been in Police custody. They've been trying to flush out Freddie's killer. Person1: You're kidding. Person2: They're letting me have this vacation. Which is why the get-up. Which is why you haven't heard from me. Person1: You know, the whole world thinks you killed Freddie? It's terrible. Person2: I know. Look, I can't talk now. Later. Later?

Person1: If I were you, Mary -- I'd go back to school. I'd make no further attempt to find Jacqueline. Person2: Why? Person1: It will make you unhappy to find Jacqueline. It would put her in danger --- great danger --

Person1: The acceptance of a secret is an obligation and in this case my dear, the obligation carried with it the necessity of dying if one betrayed that secret. You understand that don't you? Person2: Yes, I understand. Person1: Then, you also understand that you must die. Person2: No.

Person1: You stay out of this, Glinda, or I'll fix you as well! Person2: Oh, rubbish!  You have no power here. Be gone, before somebody drops a house on you, too. Person1: Very well -- I'll bide my time -- and as for you, my fine lady, it's true, I can't attend to you here and now as I'd like, but just try to stay out of my way....

Person1: Come on, I thought we had fun, rich boy -- Person2: This is not cool. Person1: It was cool last night. Person2: I have to go. Person1: Are you telling me no? Person2: No I'm sorry, now I have to get off the phone.... Person1: ....this is your mistake....

Person1: If I were you, I'd worry less about the shower and more about Rick's bachelor party. Person2: Ilene, why would I want to do that? I trust Rick. Person1: Of course you do. I trusted my ex, Mel, too. Cousin, I can only talk from experience. What do you think they do at these parties, have tea and play scrabble? Person2: Ilene, Rick promised... Person1: Debbie, don't be naive. Men are pigs.

Person1: Don't even tell me you're hot for Miss Titty Pom Poms over there. Person2: Christy's a very talented journalist. I see a Pulitzer in her future. Person1: I didn't know they gave them for Best Lip Gloss Retention During a Blow Job. Person2: Me-ow. Person1: Go ahead. Ask her to the prom. Get it over with. Person2: I have absolutely no intention-- Person1: --Do it. I triple-dog-dare you.

Person1: Here Person2: What is it?  Why, it's a toothbrush! Thanks.  Youyou had it pressed. Person1: Come on! Hurry up! Breakfast'll be ready in no time. Person2: Why, you sweet thing, you. Where'd you get it pressed? Person1: Listen, BratI'm going to count to ten. If you're not out of bed by then I'm going to yank you out myself.
Person1: Don't tell me you really are in love? Person2: Yeah and I got the bruises to prove it. So what? Person1: Nothing, it's just that's when things usually start to go wrong.

Person1: I'm thinking of moving on, Alex. This relationship doesn't feel right anymore. Person2: After everything we've been through? You won't find anyone else who treats you like I do. Person1: Maybe that's the problem. I need space and independence. It feels like you're trying to control everything. Person2: I just want the best for you, for us. Person1: I need to figure out what's best for me on my own.

Person1: You're making it too easy. Person2: You got time on your side.  Pretty soon they'll be missed and we'll have the law up our ass. Person1: They saw you kill the driver. Person2: You're up on your details, aren't you? Person1: You can rely on them to keep quiet because this is undeclared money that could land Jack there in federal prison.  He can't afford for you to get caught and have this briefcase appear as evidence. Person2: Keep talking.

Person1: Come on. We got a couple hours to eat and get some sleep. Person2: I'll eat when I'm good and ready. Person1: Kind of feeling your oats this morning. I haven't laid a hand on you for quite a while, but that doesn't mean you're too old. Person2: What makes you think you're so almighty? Telling people what to do and how to act when you don't even know how yourself.

Person1: Why did you leak our strategy to the competitors? Person2: I thought it would give us an edge, force them to react to our moves. Person1: That was reckless and has compromised our position. Person2: I just wanted to get ahead. Person1: I will make you pay for this. Trust is hard to earn and easy to break.
Person1: He wants us to follow.  The little boy... Person2: Little boy?!  That's him! Person1: He brought you to me, didn't he?  If you want Julia to live, trust me.  Trust him.

Person1: Someone is after us, Pearl. Person2: I want to go upstairs. It's cold and spidery down here. I'm hungry. Person1: Now listen to me, Pearl. You and me is runnin' off tonight. Person2: Why? Person1: If we stay here somethin' awful will happen to us. Person2: Won't Daddy Powell take care of us? Person1: No, that's just it. No.

Person1: What? Person2: Would you like to sit on my lap? Person1: No thank you. Person2: Are you sure? Person1: I'm sure. Thank you all the same. Person2: That's okay... doesn't matter. Person1: Do you want me to sit on your lap?

Person1: Your whole life is devoted to just one thing. To accumulate more money. At least there's romance in what he's doing. Person2: He's no good, Ellie, and you know it. You married him only because I told you not to. Person1: You've been telling me what not to do since I was old enough to remember.  I'm sick of it!

Person1: Hey. She says she loves you, Nick. Person2: She says a lot of things. Person1: She's getting you to help us... 'cause she knows if you don't, you're dead. You just tell us what we need to know, you two live happily ever after. My sister loves you, man, and I'm not going to let you break her heart. Person2: Wish I had a brother like you. Person1: A girl says she loves you, you say something.

Person1: Come on, just sign the loan papers for me. You'd do it if you loved me. Person2: Alice, tying love to financial obligations isn't fair or healthy. Love shouldn't be used as a manipulation tool.

Person1: No more witnesses. West's a ghost. But it doesn't matter because we have your signature, the hospital log, and Kendall's toxicology report. And that'll be enough. Person2: You're crazy -- Person1: You can't duck this, Bill. I may have done every goddamn thing in my life wrong but I won't let this happen. Person2: For the last time, I have no idea what you're talking about -- Person1: Get your hands away from the desk!

Person1: We have to go back. Person2: We're not going anywhere.  Not 'til we get what we came for. Person1: We just about got killed.  You know what happened?  We just about got killed, and you want to go on?

Person1: Okay, I know what I want this time. Person2: Anything you need. Person1: Yo' cousin, Craig.  Hook us up. Person2: That's it? Person1: Just tell him to come over here and talk to me. Person2: And I can go free? Person1: Go, fo' I change my mind.

Person1: Mr. President, Hunt wants more money. Another hundred-and-thirty thousand. Person2: Son of a bitch. Person1: He says if he doesn't get it right away, he's going to blow us out of the water.  And he means it.  Ever since his wife died in the plane crash, he's been over the edge. Person2: Pay him.  Pay him what he wants.

Person1: You don't know the power of the dark side. I must obey my master. Person2: I will not turn...and you'll be forced to kill me. Person1: If that is your destiny. Person2: Search your feelings, father. You can't do this. I feel the conflict within you. Let go of your hate. Person1: It is too late for me, son. The Emperor will show you the true nature of the Force. He is your master now.
movie: star wars: episode vi - return of the jedi

text: Person1: What's this: "I'm declining this case?"  It don't work that way. Person2: This can't be my last duty here.  It will go on and on. Person1: I know what you're thinking, okay?  You don't want to get in bed with this every night, but it's different now.  You're retiring.  In six days you're all the way gone.

Person1: Yeah? Person2: I can deliver Ganz.  But you gotta get me outta here first. Person1: You're crazy. Person2: I can help you, man, but you gotta get me out.  I got to be on the street.  Get me outta here. Person1: What's the big deal about you bein' on the street? Person2: I got a lot to protect. Person1: Bullshit. Person2: It's the only way you're gonna get Ganz. Person1: I'll think about it.

Person1: I've renegotiated the contract with our suppliers, got us a better deal. Person2: Without consulting me? That's my department, Neil. Person1: I saw an opportunity and took it. Person2: Crossing me isn’t a wise decision. We have protocols for a reason. Person1: I'll remember that next time. Just thought I was helping the company.

Person1: You got three minutes. One second longer, I shoot your father in the face. Do you understand what I just said? Person2: Yes. Person1: Do you believe me? Person2: Yes. Person1: You damn well better. Go.

Person1: "...a sincere and heartfelt apology which you will then read aloud to him before the assembled student body and faculty. Person2: Why? Person1: Our profession needs talent like yours. Destroy your career over an issue of pride? What a waste.

Person1: We think you should give up the magazine. Sell it. Let someone else run it. Whatever it takes. Person2: We want you to go to college, find a career you love, marry a nice girl from a nice family, and live happily ever after.

Person1: I had an unfortunate little run-in with him today. In fact...you might say that Mr. Tyler is in big trouble with the...authorities. Person2: You better not mess with me, Rhodes. I'd love to serve your balls to those Red Coats for lunch! Think about it! Person1: No, Miss Science. You're the one who needs to do some thinking.

Person1: I don't know about this. Person2: I don't know, either.  I want to find out.  I've never been hit, have you? Person1: No.  That's a good thing, isn't it? Person2: I don't want to die without any scars.  How much can you really know about yourself if you've never been in a fight?  Come on... you're the only person I've ever asked. Person1: Me?

Person1: Marlon and Al.... Person2: We want them.  You will not let anyone go into that house--or anything come out-- until my people recover these disks. Person1: I can't control what happens.  The Sheriffs are running the scene. Person2: You will re-assume command.  In two hours, a group of my people will arrive at York Estates.  You will tell the Sheriffs that they are an FBI tactical team.

Person1: I don't want a criminal for a boyfriend. Person2: There was a message, wasn't there? Person1: It's probably easier for you to eat the rice. Person2: Marion!  What did you tell the police? Person1: Nothing about you. Person2: Then what? Person1: Give up being a croupier, Jack. Or I'll shop you. All you have to do is keep your word. It's that simple.
Person1: I go in alone. Person2: You don't get the Mask code unless I go.

Person1: You cant go! Person2: Jesus, Jack... Person1: Dont get on that plane! Person2: Jack. Person1: Please. Lets just go have a cup of coffee. Thats all Im asking for. Im sure theres another flight to Paris tonight. Person2: What do you want from me? You want me to tell you everything that happened was okay?

Person1: You don't think I'll do it, do you? Person2: I think you're crazy! Person1: Where is it? Person2: Where's what? Person1: The money! Person2: Caesar, I don't know what you're thinking here, but if you don't put down that gun --
Person1: What were you going to do? Gold dig him for a meal? Person2: Why not? I'm hungry. Person1: Eat a carrot. Person2: Never!  I'm going in and ask him Person1: If you do, I'll break your neck.

Person1: Look, there's no reason you and I shouldn't get along. Forget all the bullshit from before - I don't even remember how it started. You took a swing at me over some thing, whatever it was - forget it. You owe me some money, right? Forget that too. But, you don't say a word about this to anybody. It's strictly between you and me, right? Person2: Whatever you want, Ray.

Person1: Now...now, I'm sorry...don't - don't....please.  It's just... I was happy.  Why get me involved? You told SEN that you weren't satisfied with me. Person2: What?...Oh, no, THX.  That's not true.  Not satisfied?  THX, I need you so much.

Person1: Fear will keep you alive. Any one who is not afraid is bound to do something foolish, and bound to die. Person2: What do you want with us? Person1: Cooperation. If you try to escape, you will be met with automatic gunfire and a barricade of your comrade's bodies will prevent you from exiting. Good day.

Person1: Uncle Terrence, you're... Person2: Yeah, I finally "checked out", thank God. But there's a bit of unfinished business. Person1: Claude. Person2: I never thought I'd ask this of anyone, Andy, but do me a favor and kill the evil son-of-a-bitch, will you?

Person1: If you really want to do something for me, you can stop making this scene right now. Person2: Oh God, I can't believe this. Person1: I'm leaving now. I've assessed the situation and I'm going.

Person1: And here's one from nice Mr. Zeiss. He says that... Person2: Why are these all opened? Person1: Well, they needed immediate answers, Frances. It's good manners and good sense. You shouldn't be bothering yourself with these right now. Person2: Then why did you bring them? Person1: It's your fan mail, little sister. Person2: You kill me, Mama. Person1: What? Person2: Go on...

Person1: This better not be a wild goose chase. Person2: Or what, you'll authorize my death a second time today? Person1: Don't forget, convict, if this psycho isn't stopped, you go right back to rotting in a prison cell.

Person1: Mister Seor Love Daddy is cool. Person2: Ya like him, huh? Person1: Yeah. Person2: Y'know, Vito, I know Pino is ya brother and shit, but the next time he hits ya, the next time he touches ya, you should "house him." Kick his ass. Person1: I don't know. Person2: If you don't make a stand, he's gonna be beating ya like a egg for the rest of your life. Person1: That's what you think? Person2: That's what I think. Person1: I don't like to fight.

Person1: That wouldn't be very sporting. Remember Huxley?  "His play is always fair and just." Person2: You're groping.  I have been fair. It's my move now. Person1: I'll give you anything you want. Anything!  Please! Person2: Don't beg, Peter.  She has to die.  I can't win unless she dies.

Person1: Allison? Why can't remember what happened to my wife? Is it something I'm on that's... that's making me forget? Person2: Easy there Trevor. You need to relax. Person1: No I need to remember. Look whatever it is take me off it. I can handle pain. I can't handle not knowing... Person2: You need to get better first Trevor. Way better.  It's okay to miss somebody. It's okay to still love someone after they're gone. But you've got to quit blaming yourself okay...? Okay?

Person1: What about money? Person2: What about it? Person1: I don't have any. Person2: Use my credit cards. Person1: I can't do that. Person2: Why not? Person1: It's illegal. Person2: Who cares? Person1: I'll get in trouble. Person2: You are in trouble. Now do it.

Person1: It's all over, J.D. Help me to stop it. Person2: You want to wipe the slate clean as much as I do. Okay, so maybe I am killing everyone in the school because nobody loves me. You have a purpose though! Remember? Let's face it, the only place different social types can genuinely get along with each other is in heaven.

Person1: You can go get your stuff right now. I'll walk you down. Person2: No, that's not, I couldn't... Person1: Listen, when someone does the kind of thing you did, you gotta do something in return. So, you stay with me until you find your David and live happily ever after. Okay?
Person1: What are you listening to, chicken ass? Person2: Ah, leave him alone.  He's doing no harm. Person1: With a face like that?  I don't want you looking at me.  You hear?
Person1: You're not going to die. Person2: What did you say? Person1: Shut up. You're going to die and he's not. Got it.
Person1: You're a dead man-- Person2: Whoa, whoa!!  Think it through!  I'm the only one knows where they are. Just let me talk for a second.
Person1: Merde... Wait here. When I return you tell me about last night, huh? Person2: But... I don't remember anything, I swear... Person1: I leave these open. Maybe something comes back to you.

Person1: Thank you. Person2: And, um ...I guess... I guess you and I, uh... Person1: Adam?  Don't even think about it. Okay? I'm sorry.  I know that sounds mean, but believe me, it would be meaner if I didn't say it. Okay? Person2: Okay. Person1: Now, let's take the truck back and get something to eat.

Person1: Do you trust him? Person2: I just figure the percentages. He wouldn't try a cross until he's got the money. Person1: Let's send his cut back -- Just keep going. Person2: If we make a mistake., he'll burn us. You make a deal, you're always better keeping your end up. Person1: I don't want to go there. Person2: Do it my way.
Person1: What do you want? Person2: You know what I want.  You know why I need you. Person1: You need to leave. Person2: I know everything about you, Diana. Person1: That's it, we're done.
movie: jason goes to hell: the final friday

text: Person1: Let's have sex.  I thought you were curious. Person2: Not about that. Person1: I'm listening. Person2: I'm afraid to tell you. Person1: I'm not armed.  Well? Person2: Why is it wrong to run? Person1: You shouldn't even think such things...  And you picked a strange person to say them to -- Person2: I suppose. But what if you want to live? Person1: So? Do what everyone does. Try like hell for renewal.

Person1: No they won't. Person2: Why not? Person1: I'll talk to them. Person2: Oh...Gooood! Person1: I'll tell you what to say. Person2: If I get you back to the lab, will you get out of my head? Person1: If I'm real, they'll get me out. If I'm not, they'll treat you. Either way you'll be better off than you are now. You'll get a reward.

Person1: What was that?  Did you hear that? Person2: It's nothing.  My men take great delight in routing the enemy.  Don't trouble yourself, beauty. Person1: It sounded like it came from the courtyard. Person2: From the parapets most likely.  The men are amused by a battlefield entertainment of my own contriving. Person1: Might we watch, too? Person2: Later, beloved... Now I wish only to be with you...
Person1: We can't go back there.  Are you crazy? You saw -- Person2: It's the only way.  It's possible your father may not be dead yet.

Person1: Oh, dear. That isn't what I -- Person2: What your mother means, Clark, is that she don't want folks to think you're special. Person1: I bless the day you came to us, son. You know that. But some people wouldn't understand.

Person1: You understand. Consider, before you laugh and say no. You will never own a throne, though you deserve one. But just as the sun will rise tomorrow, some man will rule England. And what if his veins ran not with the blood of Longshanks, but with that of a true king? Person2: I cannot love you for the sake of revenge. Person1: No. But can you love me for the sake of all you loved and lost? Or simply love me... because I love you?

Person1: Can I ask you a question? I'm sorry. I don't mean to be a pest. Person2: What? Person1: Well, I don't mean to be a pest. It was just that I was looking at you. And you look upset. I liked looking at you, but your face looks upset. And I was wondering if I could be of any assistance? Maybe I could cheer you up or somethin. Help make you happy. Who knows? Somethin' maybe.
Person1: You walk out that door and you lose your share of the money. Person2: Yeah, whatever. Person1: I mean it! Person2: Adios.

Person1: We put our lives on the line today. Malcolm X's widow was on the line today. And your guns weren't even loaded. Person2: A gun's a gun man. It don't need to be loaded. Person1: Tell that to the pigs. Better yet tell that to Malcolm. Person2: Wait a second there brother... Person1: No you wait a second. You and your "Panthers" got three choices. One you join with us and follow our rules. Two you change your name.  Or three you face annihilation.
Person1: Come in. Person2: I'd rather talk about Number Two. Person1: Don't you like girls, Mr. Cunningham? Come in, and I'll show you everything you need to know.
movie: austin powers: international man of mystery

text: Person1: I found out you were spreading rumors about me last year. Person2: Why bring that up now? It’s all in the past. Let's move on. Person1: Just because it's in the past doesn't mean it didn't hurt. Person2: Always dwelling on old things won't help you. Focus on the now.

Person1: I think I would rather just turn them over. Person2: I am not interested in what you would rather; I want to keep going. I am also offering you the money, so we don't have to turn them over because you can borrow. Person1: I need two hundred and fifty grand. Person2: No, you need five hundred grand to see me.
movie: lock, stock and two smoking barrels

text: Person1: I'm sixteen, Keri.  I should be able to live wherever I want. Person2: And I should have a son who calls me "Mom".  Looks like we're both shit out of luck. Person1: Okay, you win.  I'll call you Mom. Now can I move into the dorms? Person2: No.

Person1: Gallatin! So the righteous Starfleet Captain finally released you. Did you encounter any problems on the surface? Person2: No, sir. But it wasn't easy... being among them... Person1: I'm sure. Just don't forget what they did to us.  We'll have them rounded up in a day or two... we needn't bother with the Federation holo-ship any more. Just get the holding cells ready.

Person1: I have eighteen more minutes! Person2: I don't want to hear any more today. Person1: Why not? Person2: Mr. Follett, do you trust me or don't you? Person1: Well, I don't know... I only been seeing you -- Person2: Without trust, there's no point to any of this. You might as well not come. Person1: Now hold on, I didn't say I didn't want to come -- Person2: Good, then go.
Person1: Lydia, I will never forgive you for embarrassing me in front of my social inferiors.  You help us with these ghosts or you'll be sorry. Person2: I'm sorry already.

Person1: How about a pedicure as long as you're down there. What's this? Lo-Jack? Person2: Wherever you go on the planet, I'll find you. There's no quitting. If you try to take it off, a ring of needles will inject enough curare into your bloodstream to kill you before you hit the ground. Is all that clear? Person1: Yeah, I spy or I die.

Person1: Can't.  History report.  The Normans and the Saxons. Person2: Bogutude.  Blow it off. Person1: I really can't.  Besides, it's pretty interesting. Person2: You're weird and I'm afraid of you. Seriously, Cassandra, there's a lot cooler things you could be doing than your homework. Person1: Like what? Person2: Like my homework.

Person1: Mrs. Lampert -- Person2: What do you want? Person1: Didn't Charles tell you, Mrs. Lampert? Person2: Tell me what? Person1: It doesn't belong to you, Mrs. Lampert -- you do know that, don't you? Person2: I don't know anything. Person1: Mrs. Lampert, any morning now you could wake up dead. Person2: Leave me alone -- ! Person1: Dead, Mrs. Lampert -- like last week's news -- like Charles, Mrs. Lampert -- Person2: Stop it!

Person1: I can't believe you went through my phone without asking! Person2: I was just looking for the restaurant's number. It's not a big deal. Person1: It's about privacy, Sophie. Person2: You are overreacting. I had no bad intentions. Person1: It's still a boundary, and I need you to respect it.

Person1: He didn't mean it. You know Johnny. He's always been a hothead -- Person2: It's not him. It's them.  I can't live like this. Person1: Just give Reed a little more time. You know how he works -- analyzing every little step before he takes one -- Person2: It's easy for you to be patient. Person1: No, it's not. I thought I was done waiting for Reed... We're all in this together now, Ben.

Person1: He's lying. Person2: Jon, he's hooked up to a full-spectrum polygraph. No one has ever beaten -- Person1: I don't care -- he's manipulating it.  That bomb has been built and it's out there, somewhere. Person2: What do you expect us to do -- shut down the city, evacuate two million people on a hunch?

Person1: I wish you could see the world as I do. Deacon opened my eyes. There's no turning back from that. Person2: I don't believe that. Person1: You will. Time is on our side. Sooner or later, the Thirst always wins.

Person1: Remember when you promised you'd help me with the project and then bailed? Person2: Oh, that? Let’s forgive and forget. We should focus on the present. Person1: It's hard to forget when I had to pull an all-nighter because of that. Person2: Always holding onto the past, aren't you? Person1: It's about accountability and trust. Person2: And it's about not holding grudges. We should move on.

Person1: Large? Person2: All right, cop. I want my money. Person1: It's still my money. If you want to have a chance at any part of it, shithead, you will take my $120,000 and bet on tomorrow's game. Person2: What about the money you owe me on yesterday's game? Person1: Forget yesterday's game. The World Series is seven games not six. Put in my bet. Person2: Let me think about it. Person1: There's nothing to think about. Either you put in my bet or you ain't getting nothing.

Person1: I will not be disputed in public, do you understand me? Person2: Father, I wasn't disputing you. Person1: When you've finished medical school and you're on your own, you can do as you please.  Until then, you will listen to me. Person2: Yes sir.  I'm sorry. Person1: You know what this means to your mother, don't you? Person2: Yes sir.

Person1: Can I give you a hand, beautiful? Person2: I'm just going to my car? Person1: That's right on my way. Person2: My mother told me never to accept offers from strangers. Person1: My name is Bobby.  Now I'm not a stranger anymore.  See how easy it is for us to get to know each other, beautiful? Person2: Do you have to call me that? Person1: I don't know your real name. Person2: Maybe I don't want you to.

Person1: Congratulations. Person2: Exciting, wasn't it? Where's Jimmy? Person1: He'll be back.  What would you do if anybody gave you a bracelet? Person2: Say, "Thanks very much!" Person1: I mean if you knew it were stolen. Person2: Well, of course, I wouldn't take it. Person1: And if you liked the person, you'd naturally persuade him to give it back and go straight, wouldn't you? Person2: Sure I would--but I don't get what you're driving at. Person1: Maybe you will after you've thought it over.

Person1: Hey Lovey, come here! Lovey, I asked for a glass of wine and look what I got. Come on, sit down. Person2: So that's where you are. I might of known it. No wonder you couldn't hear me. Person1: You were asked to have a glass of wine. Sit down! Person2: And be poisoned out here in the open? Person1: Certainly not!

Person1: THEY WILL FIND OUT ABOUT YOU.  THEY WILL LOCK YOU IN A PLACE WORSE THAN BROTHER BUDDY'S. Person2: No. Person1: THEY'LL MAKE YOU BE A PIECE OF SHIT AGAIN. THEY'LL MAKE YOU BE A HARELIP AGAIN. YOU BETTER GIVE ME WHAT I WANT! Person2: No!

Person1: 'Scuse me. Person2: I know it can't be easy. Life hasn't changed that much for Reed, Sue and Johnny. At least they can go out in public. But for you? People staring. Whispering behind your back... Person1: If you're trying to cheer me up you're doing a helluva job -- Person2: I'm just saying, I know what it's like to lose something you love. To see it slip away, and know it's never coming back.
Person1: Hello? Person2: You little sleaze bag! Person1: ...Ma??? Person2: Don't you ever ask me for another thing in my life again, you've killed your poor mother with your own hands!

Person1: Mona? Person2: What'd you do to your hair? Person1: I got it done. Person2: What are you doing here? Person1: What are you doing here? Person2: Who is this man? You're engaged! Person1: You're married. Person2: You're my daughter. I won't have you acting like a tramp! Person1: You're my father. Person2: Alright. I didn't see you here. Person1: I don't know whether I saw you or not.

Person1: I brought you something tonight, MacFarlane -- an interesting specimen -- in very good condition. Person2: I've ordered nothing from you. Person1: This is a gift. Person2: I take no gifts from you. Person1: This is a gift you'll not return. Person2: Get out of here! Person1: Wait, Toddy. That's not hospitable. I want to discuss business. Person2: You are not to set foot in here again, Gray, for business or any other reason. And you're going out now!
Person1: Right, partner. Person2: Get this. We ain't partners. We ain't brothers. We ain't friends. If Ganz gets away with my money, you're gonna be sorry we ever met. Person1: Yeah.  Right.

Person1: Looks bad, doesn't it, Irene?  What about you?  Where were you last night? Person2: I was at home. Person1: Were you alone? Person2: Yes. Person1: So we don't know for sure about you, either. Person2: No. Person1: Why don't we say we were together? Person2: Why would we do that? Person1: I have better things to do this week than answer the foolish questions of some flatfoot. Don't you?
Person1: You want to get married...? Person2: You tol me you wuunt ask me again til I'm ready.... Person1: You're ready now. Person2: I'm not. Person1: That's what you think...

Person1: I'm thinking of reporting the irregularities I've noticed in the accounts. Person2: Before you do anything rash, remember, I know a lot about you. It might not be in your best interest to stir the pot. Person1: Are you threatening me? Person2: Just reminding you that everyone has secrets. Think carefully about your next move.

Person1: Phreakphreakphreakphreakphreak, dudedudedudedudedudedude... I gotta... Person2: Joey, Joey... Person1: What? whatwhatwhat? Person2: One more "dude" out of you and I'm gonna slap the shit outa you, okay? Now I'm trying to save you from yourself but you gotta stop letting your mama dress you, man! Check it...
Person1: We lost cousins, friends.  We will wash this in blood. Person2: If you want to keep your head on your shoulders, you'll do as I say.
Person1: So... You're ready for me now? Person2: You've got to help them. Person1: Can you help me? Person2: ... I will. Person1: Then I'll help them.  For a price.

Person1: No, Wes. Person2: Jessica was never any good for Paul.  You will be, you are.  And Mother -- seeing Jessica day after day -- never able to escape, never able to forget.  Please, Betsy -- it's only merciful.

Person1: What's going on? Person2: I'm going to throw out these old videos. Person1: No.  You can't bin these.  They're classics.  I'm not allowing this. Person2: Right -- let's talk about rent... Person1: Let me help.  We don't want all this shit cluttering up our lives.

Person1: That's not what I mean. Person2: Listen.  Do you want to go to jail? Taking evidence, tampering with a crime scene.  You know what they'd do. Person1: He would have done it to us, right? Person2: Exactly.  This is our little secret, partner.

Person1: I know what you did, and I'm going to tell everyone. Person2: Go ahead and try. Nobody will believe you. Person1: The truth has a way of coming out, Mark. Person2: You've always been the dramatic one. But without proof, your words mean nothing. Person1: Maybe I have more evidence than you think.

Person1: Look, if I made you nervous or uncomfortable or creeped you out-- Person2: Yes on all counts. Person1: I'm sorry.  It wasn't my intention.  But I had to see you. Person2: You'd think a guy who's taken on the job of saving the world would have a few more important things to do than traipse around after some girl. Person1: I haven't been able to get you off my mind. Person2: You need to get out more. Person1: C'mere, I want to show you something.

Person1: I really think we should reconsider the project direction. The current approach has too many pitfalls. Person2: Lila, I appreciate your input, but I've made my decision. Person1: I just think it's crucial to evaluate all angles before diving in. Person2: And who writes your paycheck? Sometimes, it's best to follow orders and trust the process. Person1: Understood, but I still felt it was my duty to voice my concerns.

Person1: Why did you have LUH come here? Person2: Why are you so concerned? Person1: What's going on? Person2: I want you for my roommate. Person1: Where's LUH? Person2: It will be good for both of us. I've got it all arranged.
Person1: If you ever loved me -- if you ever loved honor, or anything else -- then stand now, and let it happen. Person2: I cannot, Athos.  Dearly as I love you, I cannot.
movie: the man in the iron mask

text: Person1: I don't gamble. Person2: Don't be a spoilsport. It's only a few quid. Person1: It's nothing to do with money. I don't gamble.

Person1: Wade, you're done.  Let me have the shop keys. Person2: You two, don't you get it? He's using you. You're his slaves.  Jesus Christ, Jack, don't you see that? Person1: The key, Wade. Person2: Yeah, you can have the key. It's the key that's kept me locked to you all these years. I give it to you with pleasure.  Now I'm free. See how easy it is, Jack? All you got to do is give back what the man gave you, and you're free of him.  I've got to call my brother.

Person1: Father, by creating a little destruction, I am, in fact, encouraging life!  So, in reality, you and I are in the same business! Person2: Destroying a glass is one thing..killing people with the weapons you produce is quite another. Person1: Let me reassure you Father..I will never kill more people in my entire life than religion has killed in the last 2000 years.
Person1: Do you have something to say? Person2: No. Person1: Then keep your mouth shut.
Person1: Romance is just a vestigial biological response to procreation... Person2: Aw, you're in love with me... You just dont know it yet.
Person1: Come on. Let's go for a drink. Person2: I don't really like to drink. Person1: You have to. It's a tradition. Person2: Well, if I have to, I have to.

Person1: Hey, I had a great time with Alex and Sam yesterday. They're really fun! Person2: You shouldn’t listen to or hang out with them. I've heard things, you know. Person1: What things? They seemed nice to me. Person2: Just trust me. You should spend more time with me and my friends instead.

Person1: You can do it, Sal. Person2: No. No, no. Person1: Sal... listen to me, Sal! You have to do it. Person2: I want to go home, Merle. Person1: You have to think about this, Sal. Listen to me, Sal! You have to think about this. Person2: This is horrible! Person1: Listen to me, Sal. If you don't do it they'll put you in the pit. If they put you in the pit, Sal, you're gonna die... Sal, do you understand? Person2: Merle, I wanna go home!

Person1: Yeah!  YEAH!!!  Man I'm getting so HOT!!! Person2: Do you always think about sex?  I'm talking about some very important stuff here! Person1: Listen buttercup, let's make love and forget about the whole thing. Person2: Is sex the only thing that matters to you?
Person1: Where are you going? Person2: I don't know. Person1: When are you going to be back? Person2: I don't know. Person1: Well, until you know, you can't go. Person2: Oh, okay.

Person1: I can't believe I almost signed that contract without reading the fine print. That could've been a disaster. Person2: Always read everything before signing, Ben. You're lucky to have someone like me looking out for you. Person1: I know, Elaine. Sometimes I get too impulsive. Person2: Just remember, not everyone has your best interests at heart. Stick close and I'll help guide you. Person1: Thanks, Elaine. I genuinely appreciate it, even if it feels a bit overwhelming at times.

Person1: Having fun yet?  No?  I'll give you a hint.  Remember whatshername? Person2: Shelly? Person1: Miss her? Person2: Yes. Person1: Kill the men who killed you both, and the Day of the Dead will be your reunion.

Person1: I'm not interested in what you think. Person2: You've no right to do this to her, Mr. Cluett. Why don't you think it over? It's only gonna get you into a lot of trouble. Person1: I tell you, I'm not interested in your opinion. Person2: No?  Then maybe you'll understand, Mrs. Dickson. Oh, gee, he's crazy about you. Nobody knows it better than you. If he ever finds out, it'll kill him.
Person1: I've come to strike a bargain with you.  I wish to learn the power of changing. Person2: And what would'st I gain from this bargain? Person1: Your life. Person2: How?
Person1: You love me now, don't you? Person2: Very much.

Person1: The Good Witch... Person2: Sailor... Lula loves you. Person1: But I'm a robber and a manslaughterer and I haven't had any parental guidance. Person2: She's forgiven you of all these things... You love her... Don't be afraid, Sailor. Person1: But I'm wild at heart. Person2: If you are truly wild at heart, you'll fight for your dreams... Don't turn away from love, Sailor... Don't turn away from love... Don't turn away from love.

Person1: I expect to hear from you soon. If Huey Newton takes a crap, I want to know how big it was. Otherwise I'm gonna come looking for you. And I won't be as "friendly" as today. Person2: I got you.
Person1: "Big and older"? Person2: You can shut up now. Person1: You are a charmer. Person2: I swear I'll shoot you in your sleep. Person1: Next time try "fat and haggard."
Person1: Misery's Return? Person2: I know you didn't mean it when you killed her, and now you'll make it right.

Person1: What makes you say that? Person2: If he didn't you'd never sit still while this was happening. Person1: You sure? Maybe that's the kind of friend I am. Person2: Nah!  What's he got? This is a nice saloon, but there are other nice saloons. It's not the money. Not for you. Why can't I get ahold of it?  Cobb says there's no telling what you're going to care about. Person1: Is that what he said? Well, he figured it okay this time.
Person1: I could fight you on this. Person2: You could.  But, if I leave without your signature, this agreement begins to disintegrate; benefits shrink, options narrow, compensations shrivel.

Person1: You're purposely making me talk while we do this...  ...because you think this is good for me...  ...and you're a sadistic bastard... Person2: Yes. Person1: ...who thinks there's nothing really wrong with me. Person2: Oh, there's something wrong with you, all right. Especially after hearing that dream of yours, about the Roto-Rooter.

Person1: Wait -- what're you doing? Person2: I'm going down. Person1: Down? Down there?! Are you crazy! Person2: I'm not leaving without those stones. Person1: You're gonna get killed chasing after your damn fortune and glory! Person2: Maybe... someday.  Not today.
movie: indiana jones and the temple of doom

text: Person1: Oh, c'mon, Laura.  Just say something. Lie, if you want.  It'd stop me asking you questions and it'd make me feel better. Person2: Well I was gonna lie and now I can't, because you'd know I was lying. Person1: Well why the heck would you want to lie, anyway? Person2: To make you feel better. Person1: Oh, great...

Person1: Congratulations, Mrs. Peel. You have been a worthy opponent. You have tracked us down. You are within an ace of winning. Person2: This isn't a game. Person1: Quite right, but we still make the rules. Person2: Rules are made to be broken. Person1: People, too. Person2: Then who wins? Person1: You and I. Together. But first you must confront your greatest enemy. Who could that be, Mrs. Peel? The answer is obvious ...

Person1: Don't, Beth. Person2: But I have to, Norman. Person1: I promise -- Person2: Promise what, Norman?  Tell me! Person1: Beth -- Person2: You think I'd belive you?  Believe anything you might say now?  After you lied to me about telling Barnes about my past.  About my problems.  My problems.  Not yours.  Not his.  Mine. Person1: Don't, Beth.  Please. Person2: It's either this... or I kill you.

Person1: He's right, Kate. Daddy's dead! He was too far away. If flinging that door and filling this room with those bat-things would save him, I'd fling it. The only thing it'll do is turn us into one of them. Person2: He needs our help! Person1: He's beyond our help. You saw him get bit. I saw him get bit. We all saw it. You can't help him. I've got no one left to lose but you. I can't be alone again. We're sticking together.

Person1: Maybe it's all the pressure, Jake. The money. Things like that. Or your wife. Person2: Why do you bring her up? Person1: 'Cause she's always on your mind. Person2: When was the last time I said a word? Person1: It has nothin' to do with talkin'.

Person1: I overheard your conversation yesterday. Blackmailing a colleague? Really? Person2: That was a private conversation. You had no right to eavesdrop. Person1: And you had no right to exploit someone's vulnerability. Person2: Stay out of this, Fiona. It's none of your business. Person1: I will let everybody know what kind of person you are. No one deserves to be treated the way you're treating him.

Person1: Alright, where is she? Person2: And who are you? Person1: Who am I?  I'm gonna be your worst living nightmare until you start breaking it down for me.  You understand? Where did you get the car! Person2: I'm done talking until I get a lawyer.

Person1: This is the newest technology approved for general implementation. It's called a locater implant. Every parolee gets one.  We're going to know where you are every second for the rest of your life. Person2: If you try to run, I'll hunt you down and kill you myself. Person1: Yes or no, Mr. Barnes?

Person1: Listen to me, Neo.  I know why you're afraid to go through that door.  You can't get free of thinking that I could be wrong.  You must believe me.  There is a greatness inside of you, Neo.  A greatness that is going to lift you to unimaginable heights and that in time will change the world. Person2: Morpheus, I don't know -- Person1: I know.  That is why it is so important for you to go.  Please, Neo, I'm asking you to find whatever respect you may have for me and trust me.

Person1: Let me tell him.  Let him decide. Person2: You're not gonna see him again. Person1: What... what makes you think you can order me around?! Person2: Maybe I'm not making myself clear. You're probably the first girl Billy-Boy's ever fallen in love with, and I know for sure you're the first he's slept with.  So, how's he gonna feel...  ... when he finds out that the only first he is for you is the first guy who didn't have to pull out at the last second to get his close-up?

Person1: I love this.  We're onto something really big.  I can smell it, Ray.  We're going to make some headlines with this one. Person2: Hey, hey, hey, stresshound!  Are you nuts? If anybody found out about this we'd be in serious trouble.  The judge couldn't have been clearer - no ghostbusting. Person1: Relax.  We're going to keep this whole thing nice and quiet, low key, no profile.

Person1: Easy.  I just wanted to tell you Things're about to start changing Around here.  Lots of so-called Hard cases and tough-nuts swagger Around this town but none of 'em's got a clue about the real play.  None of 'em. Person2: I don't understand. Person1: You will after tonight.  Bet on it.

Person1: Mr. Caiman, you're married. Person2: And you're beautiful... Person1: Mr. Caiman... Person2: Call me Charlie. Person1: Mr. Caiman, I've been doing extra research for you after hours and weekends for nearly a year. And I've never asked for anything but this job is really important to me. I'm too old to be an assistant anymore. I need to know this job is going someplace. Person2: So have dinner with me tonight. Person1: I can't. Person2: It's your choice.

Person1: What are you crazy? Person2: Do you know how easy it would be for you to just disappear. Shit, you wouldn't even wash up for weeks. Do you understand? I want you to get off your backside. I want a bunch of Panthers served up on a plate. I want you to set 'em up... armed robbery!! Person1: I can't... they don't work that way... Person2: Forget how they work. Just do it. Like your man says, "By any means necessary."

Person1: To lunch. Person2: To lunch, you say. I am having coffee and sandwiches sent in. We are not leaving until we have everything ready for the opening. Person1: But I have some friends waiting. Person2: That is unfortunate. They will have to wait. Person1: I will only be gone about half an hour. Person2: If you leave before the work is done, you will be gone for a much longer period ... you will be gone for good. Person1: All right, I'll tell them. They're right here in front.

Person1: Don't be afraid to say hello. Your friend with the recent transplant is in no condition to deliver that briefcase.  So I've taken on the task. Person2: Who are you? Person1: Let me talk to the lady again. Person2: There's no lady here. Person1: If you've already killed her that's fine.  I'll keep the bonds and the cash.  We got nothing to discuss. Person2: Hold on. Person1: If her kid or her old man have been harmed we've also got nothing to talk about. Person2: Let her tell you.

Person1: The wasps were meant for Michael - but there's only so much you can control, isn't there?  The great and powerful lasher - undone by a faulty ladder-..  Why would you hurt him...?!  Answer me. Person2: I 1ove you, Rowan.  I've always loved you.  I only wanted to be in your thoughts. To bring myself into your thoughts - so I could be as we are now. Person1: YOU VIOLATED ME!!!  ON MY WEDDING NIGHT! Person2: Explain this to me --- violated...? Person1: You bastard...

Person1: You don't find that repugnant? Person2: Just the way the world works.  Look, as far as tweakers go, you aren't a bad guy.  You never hurt anyone but yourself as far as I know. Person1: Tell that to Bobby ... and his wife and kid. Person2: Bobby laid his own tracks.  He could have gone quietly but he played the hard-ass con till the end. And as far as I'm concerned, he wife and kid are a hell of a lot better off without him.  Now take the money.
Person1: George, uh... you're gonna break his little chest bones... Person2: Stay out of this, Matthew.  Tell me where the drug has been taken or I will crush your lungs against this wall.

Person1: Nobody's going anywhere with that gold now. Anybody tries to board, we'll know about it.  You can do what you want, Greer. But neither of us is gonna risk saving your ass down here if it comes to that. Person2: Fine with me.

Person1: You should know if you bring in anything over ten thousand you have to declare it. You forgot or what? You could get a two hundred and fifty thousand dollar fine, plus two years in prison. Now you want to talk to us about it, or you want to talk to Customs? Person2: I'm not saying another word.

Person1: Yeah. Sure. Person2: How 'bout this. If you're in, he's in. Person1: I gotta tell you, Mr. Reuben, I'm not comfortable getting in any deeper. It's one thing to look after Jess... Person2: You're ready to move up. Christ, the way you busted up the place, you're doing worse already. May as well get paid instead of punished. Person1: It's not that I don't appreciate the offer... Person2: Do me a favor. Think about it. Is that too much too ask? Person1: No. Okay. I'll think about it.

Person1: There's lots of things I haven't done, but his ain't high on the list.  Don't take it personally. Person2: I think you're just a little scared now, about what you might find once the lights go out.  A little scared... and a lot curious.  Maybe more than you want to admit.  But doesn't that turn you on, that curiosity and fear, swirling together?  Think of it as broadening your horizons. Person1: I like my horizons narrow. Person2: Your voice is saying no, but your body is saying yes.

Person1: He might be interested... but it would mean another five thousand. Person2: We can do that. Person1: Well, well, I'll have to put my thinking-cap on about all this. You'll leave the money as a deposit?  Very good.
Person1: Nor will there be. My husband does not negotiate with terrorists. Person2: You will be the first to pay for that mistake.

Person1: I'm sorry to put all this on you, Stanley -- Person2: I have money. Person1: ...what...? Person2: I have money to give you. Person1: No.  No.  I have to do this on my own. Person2: I can take you to get money.  I don't need it...I don't need it -- listen to me

Person1: Friend of yours? Person2: Look, he's got nothing to do with this... let him go... Person1: Can you guess what I'm going to say next? Person2: He doesn't know anything... he's got nothing to do with this... Person1: Bring the film, or we kill him.

Person1: What was I supposed to do?  I told the truth.  Why should the truth upset you?  It's not as if you're from a convent. Person2: I want my money.  I'm getting out of here.  I don't want anything more to do with you. Person1: Can we talk about this?  Can you just try to calm down? Person2: Your goddamned friend, he thinks the only reason I'm with you is for the money.
Person1: I don't mean to be a prick, but that's how I feel. Person2: Of course.  I don't want to scare you off.  Not before I'm finished with you.

Person1: Now listen. Now that you're on your way, it would be stupid of you to stop. Think of Sebastian as a tutor. Let him instruct you. Person2: I don't love him. I love Ronald. Person1: So? Don't you want to make Ronald a happy pappy? Practice makes perfect, Cecile. My advice is to sleep with as many people as possible. Person2: But that would make me a slut.  Wouldn't it? Person1: Cecile, everybody does it. It's just that nobody talks about it.

Person1: Can I get that credit card from you? Person2: I don't like to use that credit card, Dignan. Person1: Why not? Person2: Because my mom gets the bill. Person1: She's not going to notice, Anthony. Person2: I don't want to use it. Person1: Well, then cut it in half. Person2: I keep it for emergencies. Person1: Anthony, we're on the run. This is an emergency. It's only fair that...
Person1: If Chet sees you, he'll kill you, don't you know that? Person2: I don't care.  I love you, Chris.  You deserve better than Chet and I'm it. Please accept these. Person1: Knox, you're crazy.
Person1: When my back gets better I'mma beat the black off you, Day-Day. Person2: I know.  I'm sorry. Person1: Sorry, my ass.
Person1: Shut you mouth or you'll be next. Person2: You've stabbed me, man. Person1: You were in my way.

Person1: What makes you so sure this will work? Person2: I told you. He already tried to contact me once. If you saw his face... He was desperate to tell me something. I owe him this. Person1: I don't know... Person2: Listen, either he wastes away as a pathetic vegetable or he can give what's left of his life to save hundreds of potential victims. He's a McDermott. I know what his choice would be. Person1: I suppose you're right. But I still don't like it.

Person1: I've known soldiers who've had their heads blown off who were more intelligent than you two.  Not only have you failed to protect your most valuable possession from theft - but you didn't even know it'd been stolen!  I'd sooner buy heroin from the guy who sells drugs outside my grandson's school than anything from you guys. Person2: I am sorry you feel that way. Person1: And I'm sorry you look that way, short-ass.  That suit stinks and you obviously dye your hair.
Person1: Hey look, I got some business down in San Diego. Whattaya say you come with me, stay a few days? Person2: No, Harry, I can't -- Person1: You're coming.

Person1: I can't.  If I had a minute to think, maybe, but I know you're wrong. Person2: Am I? Person1: Look -- we're under a lot of pressure, we're tired, you're not thinking straight. Person2: You mean, you think I'm cracking? Person1: No.  I didn't say that. Person2: Then what, Norman?

Person1: No!  You're playing with my mind! Person2: I'm trying to play with your body! Person1: I knew it--you're seducing me! Person2: Of course I'm seducing you for Godsakes, and I'm doing a damn poor job of it--  Aren't I pretty? Person1: I think you're real cute. Person2: Cute?!  I hate cute!  Baby ducks are cute!  I wanta be exotic and mysterious! Person1: You're exotic and mysterious and cute--that's why I better leave.

Person1: What's that for? Person2: To celebrate how masterfully you destroyed Roston today. Person1: Rebecca -- we shattered a man's life in open court. Person2: Forget him!  He tried to shatter mine. Person1: He was only doing what he thought was right. Person2: You're too weak, Frank.  When you want something you have to do what- ever it takes to get it.  If something gets in your way you remove it.

Person1: Are you okay?  I wish I hadn't told you what I did.  But I can't help the way I feel.  You don't hold that against me, do you? Person2: No.  That wouldn't be fair.  Where are we going, Jerry? Person1: It would be a lot easier for me to show you instead of tell you.  But first things first.

Person1: I did not get the report from an MI-6 agent. Person2: Who did you get it from? Person1: I am just a middle man. I am doing the honourable thing and returning the money to its rightful owner... Person2: And we know how difficult that can be for the Swiss. Person1: Your last chance. Take the money. Person2: Your last chance. Give me the name. Person1: Stripped of all your weaponry, you still threaten me?

Person1: I'd come back-- Person2: But ef you do whup me, I swear you better not ever go to sleep again, because the minute you go to sleep, or you're settin' down, or your back's turned, I'm gonna knock you belly-up with a bucket.

Person1: I am going to do you a great favor.  I am going to take you with us to Gitarama. Person2: I do not want to go to Gitarama, General. Person1: You cannot go back to the hotel. The crazy men are going there now. Better to come with me.
Person1: There are two more prisoners, Admiral. Do you want them killed too?  Surrender your vessel! Person2: All right, damn you! All right!  Give me a minute to inform my crew.
movie: star trek iii: the search for spock

text: Person1: You come out here and talk to me, you jerk! Person2: Will you stop it? You're drunk, you're on drugs. You're gonna - Person1: I am not! Person2: You're gonna be sorry if you don't stop that. Person1: Don't you threaten me! Person2: You'll wake the whole neighborhood! Person1: Don't you threaten me!

Person1: What time is it? Person2: Hang loose.  We got all night. Person1: That maid saw us.  She could identify us too. Person2: You still want to go home, Moose? Person1: No. Person2: Then shut your mouth before your guts run out!
Person1: Keep it safe.  Return it to me when we are together again. Person2: I will. Person1: If you don't, I'll come after you. And I won't let you off so easy.

Person1: Wait a minute. Wait a minute.  Matt, do you realize you're up against something? You're being charged with murder. It's serious, son. Now come on, I know you didn't do it.  But we've got to make them believe it. Come on, tell the truth, where were you last night? Person2: I can't tell you.

text: Person1: I give up. Person2: You.  You're the same.  No matter where you go, there you are. Always the same old you.  Let me suggest that you take a vacation from yourself. Person2: You're gonna love this. --We offer you a choice of alternate identities during your trip.

It's only a five-hour drive. And it'll probably clear up, once we hit the desert.  Heck, it'll probably clear up once we drive around the corner.  I promise.

It will end, one way or another.  Francis, nothing will replace your sons but helping us will justify their sacrifice.

Look, would you mind if I gave you some constructive criticism? Person1: Actually, yes. Person2: Well, you shouldn't  Be more aggressive, Clark! Trust your instinct! I'm not growing old chasing snails and dying from terminal crotch rot.... Person2: It's not a bad life, Jake.... Person1: You're afraid of the competition out there....

Person2: You better make sure your old man asks her out, because if he doesn't, they may never have a first date. And if they don't have a first date, they won't have a second date. If they don't have a second date, they won't fall in love. If they don't fall in love, they won't get married, and if they don't get married, you'll never be born!
