Listen believe me, once we get to the moon, your tone is going to change. Person1: How is it going to be different from this?  Go see some boring footprint under glass? Person2: Look you were the one who wanted to do something different, something to tell all your friends.  Any chump can go to Nassau.

Person1: Hey, Gallagher! Person2: Yeah? Person1: How about my breakfast? How do you expect me to ring a curtain down on an empty stomach? Person2: It'll be ready in a minute. Person1: Never mind that. If you can't get my breakfast ready - and can't get here on time in the morning - then you can go get yourself another job. Person2: Sorry, boss Person1: Don't be sorry. Just get the breakfast, that's all.

Person1: No, you idiot. I said "Is it a receptacle tip?" Not, is Luis a despicable twit. Is it a receptacle tip? Get off me. Person2: Is it a what? Person1: Pull out. Person2: I'm ignoring you. Person1: Pull out, goddamnit! Person2: What do you want, Courtney?

Person1: Shhh. Hold it down! I'll take you guys down, but ya gotta come right back up! 'Kay? Person2: 'Kay, Mac! Person1: Shhh... Remember this is a privilege, so I don't want none of you goons up. Kay? Person2: 'Kay, Mac! Person1: 'Kay, let's see...  Cheswick first ... then Billy... Martini... Scanlon... Sefelt... Fredrickson... Taber an' the Chief... 'Kay Person2: 'Kay! Person1: Shhh!
movie: one flew over the cuckoo's nest

text: Person1: It's okay. It's Martin The door begins to open revealing Debi and Newberry. Person1: I know what I do isn't moral, per se, but if you could just look past that, you'd see a man worth loving. Person2: Don't listen to him, he's a professional.
Person1: What's your name? Person2: Jacob. Person1: Okay, Jacob, get up and sit your ass down on the bed. Make a wrong move and I'll shoot you in the face.

Person1: I gave you that tongue and I can rip it out! Person2: No, I really like my tongue... we're very attached.  Oyyyy... Okay, now... promise you won't get angry. Person1: Why would I ever be angry with you, little friend?

Person1: Peter, you have to admit-- Person2: --admit what?  That I was right about you in the steam room?  That you're willing to do anything to find out what you want?  Would you like me to leave so you can search the rest of the room?

Person1: There's another promise you must make me. That little girl who comes here...she mustn't ever come to see you again. Promise me you won't see her. Person2: I-shan't see her. No, Barbara, no. Person1: If that child comes here...if I find her trying to steal your love from me...I'll kill her. Yes, I'll kill her. Person2: I'll not see her, Barbara. I promise.
movie: the curse of the cat people

text: Person1: I say none of us leave this room until our young Mary here stops jerking us around and decides once and for all who she wants. Now Mary, I know this is difficult but you really will be doing them all a favor to tell them the truth about us. Person2: Are you crazy? Why would I pick you? You're a murderer.

Person1: I won't.  And when I tell Drew about it, he won't either. Person2: You won't tell him, and even if you did, he'd clock it and punch it into his laptop in order to pull out some key phrases when he gives the Commencement Speech at Wharton. Person1: You're terrible. Person2: I know.  But I'm the only father you've got.

Person1: We can't climb over that. We'll break our necks! Person2: No. We won't. I have climbed it a time or two before, and I know all the places to step. Just follow me...move easy...don't look down...and don't stop. If you stop, you'll crash through for sure. Person1: I'm not climbing that. Person2: Give me the cat. I'll take care of it myself.

Person1: It's a very nice letter. But I have to go with what's best for the students. Person2: What does that mean? Person1: I need someone to work on budget projections. Person2: Office work? Person1: Or, of course, you could take a sabbatical the rest of the year.

Person1: Bonasera, we know each other for years, but this is the first time you come to me for help.  I don't remember the last time you invited me to your house for coffee...even though our wives are friends. Person2: What do you want of me?  I'll give you anything you want, but do what I ask! Person1: And what is that Bonasera?

Person1: Susie, as always, is free to say anything she thinks.  Go on, dear, say exactly what's on your mind, dear. Person2: Those "dears" sound like daggers. May I suggest that you stop DARING her to speak? Person1: May I lift my eyebrows?  What is this?  What are you trying to do? Person2: I'm trying to get Susie to stand up to you.  But your manner is so threatening that she's afraid to speak! Person1: Son, you raise your voice again and you'll be outa here on your golden pratt!

Person1: Mr. Johnson is very well connected. If you were to let us go, I guarantee he would show you his appreciation, if you know what I mean. Person2: Are you offering me a bribe? Person1: I'm just trying to pay the toll on the road to justice. Person2: You may be able to buy your way out of trouble up in New York City, but down here we take murder seriously.
Person1: It doesn't matter. Your life is hard enough. Person2: You're a liar. Person1: You know I'm not. Person2: YOU'RE A LIAR! Person1: Look at me.

Person1: I need you to remember me, Kate.  How I am right now, right this very moment.  I need you to put that image in your heart and keep it with you, no matter what happens. Person2: Are you okay, Jack? Person1: Please, just promise me youll do that. You have to promise, Kate. Because if you dont, then its like it never happened and I dont think I could live with that.

Person1: Listen, is this your idea of a joke? Person2: More of a game really. Person1: What kind of a game? Person2: You seem to be familiar with the STAB movies. Here's how we play. I ask you a question. You get it right, your girlfriend lives. You answer wrong, she dies. Person1: I swear to God if you lay a finger on her I'll kill you! Person2: Maybe so, but right now, we play the game. First question, Your girlfriend's counting on you, Name your girlfriend's character in STAB 2?

Person1: Hey!  I'm getting a little tired of this. Person2: You volunteered, didn't you?  Aren't we paying you for this? Person1: Yeah, but I didn't know you were going to give me electric shocks.  What are you trying to prove? Person2: I'm studying the effect of negative reinforcement on ESP ability. Person1: I'll tell you the effect!  It pisses me off! Person2: Then my theory was correct.
Person1: I should at least have you, don't you think? Person2: If you get me pregnant with a boy he'll be a double direct heir and will end up killing you for the throne.

Person1: I didn't know you and Brady had anything okay? Person2: You knew. You just didn't care. Person1: He's not married. Besides, I've got a right to do what's best for me. Person2: Don't you mean what you do best? Person1: Wise up to what men want Rachel, or Brady won't be the last man you lose to another woman.
movie: halloween 4: the return of michael myers

text: Person1: Endorse me in public.  Do that and I'll make you rich and set you free. I'll return your estates.  I know you would give anything to be outside again.  Endorse me and you will be free.  Think of it.  What would you do with your freedom? Person2: If you set me free I will find my way back to the army, march on Rome and depose you.  Then, the army and I will restore the Republic so that animals like you will never control human destinies again.

Person1: I'm gonna quit. Person2: What?!? Person1: Each show is worse than the next. Person2: Are you nuts?!  40 million people watch you every week! Person1: So?  What do they know? Person2: Absolutely nothing!  That's the beauty!  It's credibility.  You make them love you... and then later, on your special, you'll screw with their heads!

Person1: Why did you go to the hospital? Person2: I don't know. Person1: You were just curious? Person2: I guess... Person1: About Susan? Person2: I wouldn't put it that way. Person1: What way would you put it? Person2: You tell me, Bill. Person1: How about you telling me?  When I ask a simple question, I expect a straight answer.  That's what I'm used to.  Anybody who doesn't give it to me, I fire. Person2: Are you going to fire me, Bill?

Person1: There's one sure way to find out how you feel. Person2: What's that? Person1: Let me kiss you. Person2: No. Person1: You're not afraid are you? Person2: Of course not, but...there are things we don't understand. Person1: If we wait until we understand everything we'll be dead. Come on. You can learn more from one kiss than from years in school. Person2: Well...I guess one is all right.

Person1: Yeah? Person2: Mr. Malkovich? Person1: Who's calling? Person2: You don't know me, but I'm a great admirer of yours. Person1: How'd you get this number? Person2: It's just that I fantasize about you and, well, speaking to you now has gotten me sort of excited and...

Person1: Are you Klingman? Person2: Who's asking? Person1: Where can we talk? Person2: Right here. Person1: I represent the interests of the Corleone family.  We make the invitation to you to tie up your affairs and be out of the hotel by Monday morning. Person2: Who do you think you're talking to? Person1: You said you were Klingman. Person2: You don't come in here, talk to an owner in Las Vegas like that. Person1: You missed my point; you are no longer an owner. Person2: Get out of my hotel.

Person1: Every time I bring up moving to a different city for my job, you change the subject. Person2: It's a big decision, Lena. There's a lot to consider. Person1: It feels like you're pushing me away. Like you’re abandoning me. Person2: That's not it at all. I'm just worried about what such a big move might do to our relationship. Person1: We can work through it together, but I need you to be on board with me.

Person1: I've got evidence of the shortcuts you've been taking in the production process. Person2: That's a serious accusation, Tara. Person1: It's not an accusation if it's the truth. Person2: Watch your step; it would be unfortunate if things got ugly. Person1: I'm only interested in ensuring the company's integrity. Do what you must.

Person1: Get out of this room and get back to work. Person2: I don't have to listen to you anymore. Person1: I am in charge now. Get back to work or I'll fire you. Person2: Let me ask you Mr. Manager, do you notice a smell of cockroaches? If I were to leave this room, I'm sure I could find this smell. I know people who could cleanse it. But maybe it doesn't bother you? Why is that? Are used to this smell? Not me, I need a clean room to escape it.

Person1: Later. But first -- him. Person2: David? Person1: Exactly. Now I've been thinking -- Person2: Oh, good. Person1: He won't do anything for me, but for you -- Person2: Forget it. Person1: He isn't safe up there. If you really cared about him, you'd use your influence to get him down, then he'd be safe. Person2: And the money? Person1: We could put it somewhere. Person2: Where he can't get it? Person1: Now you thought of that, not me. Person2: Forget it -- he'll come down.

Person1: You ain't gonna make a fuss, are you?  Nothing a man can do when a woman make up her mind. Person2: I never laid a hand on her in anger. Not a day. Not even when I's drinkin'. But this business got me wonderin' what a good shake and slap would do for her. Person1: That kind of talk is between us. Don't you go in there with that shit on your tongue. Person2: I didn't start this, R.L.

Person1: Nothing. I'm telling you I just want to make you happy. That's all. Just trust me. Person2: I don't want you to hurt me. Person1: I don't want you to hurt you. I'll be gentle. Person2: Do you care about me? Person1: Of course I do.

Person1: I thought I was going to see Max. Person2: You misunderstood.  No one sees Max. Person1: Then what am I doing here? Person2: Allowing Max to see you and hear what you've got to say. Person1: I don't communicate very well through a shroud. Person2: If Max doesn't like what you have to say, you'll be wearing that shroud indefinitely. Person1: I'm willing to take the chance. Person2: Very well.

Person1: John?  John where are you going? Person2: I think this heat is making me crazy.  I was crazy to come back here, I'm crazy for listening to anyone in this town, and I'd sure as hell be crazy if I spent another minute in this place. Person1: John, please-- Person2: I don't know what I was thinking, but I can't do it. Person1: What are you talking about? Person2: Kill someone.  I can't do it. Person1: Is it so bad?  It would be quick. He wouldn't even have to feel it.

Person1: I'd keep away from him. Person2: What? Person1: The new man. I'd keep away from him, if I were you. Person2: Why's that? Person1: You don't want to know, but he's damaged goods -- real damaged goods, if you know what I mean. Person2: Yeah, Mary-Kay, I think I do. Thanks a bunch for the advice.

Person1: That only leaves the rest. Person2: You don't have any baggy shorts? Pajama bottoms? Person1: Sorry.  My pajamas are tailored. Would it be too distressing to continue with the towel?  No more immodest than a kilt, you know. Person2: Do I have any other choice? Person1: Very sporting of you, Clayton.

Person1: How long have you known? Person2: Six months.  I found some marijuana, that's all.  And a little pipe about two inches long.  I talked with her. She said her friends smoked pot and drank -- Person1: Explain to me how you could think that I shouldn't know about this. Explain to me how this wouldn't be relevant to me.  As a parent. Person2: She asked me not to.

Person1: Ooh, now, see, if I'da known there was a beautiful woman next door, I'da done this different.  Let's start over.  My name's George.  What's yours? Person2: Just think of me as the person next door who likes it quiet, and we'll get along fine. Person1: Now, don't be like that.  Tell you what. How about if I take you out on a date to apologize for my rudeness?

Person1: Quiet.  Would I get the loans? Person2: This time I imagine you would, yes.  Hmm...  With all this in mind, Mr. Kross, I can't logically make a formal bid on your company, can I? Person1: You'd be initiating a financial battle you'd ultimately lose, Mr. Harris. Person2: You're very right.  I think the best thing we could all do is go home.

Person1: Swear to God, on the Bible, you won't try to escape and you'll get us across the border. Person2: I swear to God I won't try to escape and I'll do my best to get you into Mexico. Person1: You best better get it done, Pops.

Person1: You hear me, Martin?  Open the outer door. Person2: Chaz, if it's an organism, and we let it in, the ship will be infected. Person1: We can't leave him out here, open the door. Person2: Chaz, listen to me -- we've broken every rule of quarantine.  If we bring an organism on board, we won't have a single layer of defense left. Person1: Martin, this is an order!  Open the door!

Person1: Everything's going exactly as we planned. Person2: Not quite. You haven't announced our engagement yet. Person1: It must have slipped my mind. Person2: Your mind is so slippery. Person1: Don't worry, Pootchkie. My womanizing days are over. You're my Lady Macbeth, my Imelda... my Nicole.  We're such an incredible team. Who could possibly stop us?

Person1: I'm not playin' myself no mo'. Person2: How you sound? Person1: I won't do it anymore. Person2: Manray, I'm very sorry about ya boy Cheeba and Sloan.  Believe me, it gave me no joy pulling ya coattail about her, just lookin' out for a brother.  I feel you, all this stuff happenin' at once but you can't let if affect your work.  You gotta be professional. Person1: I'm always gonna be that.  But I ain't doing no more buck dancing. Person2: No costume.  No blackface.

Person1: I've been thinking about that.  I've decided to give it to you after I've collected the inheritance.  You can take that one if you want -- but there's another copy. Person2: That wasn't the deal. Person1: So, sue me.  Things have changed.  I think you should go home -- and after you leave I see no reason for us to ever have contact again. Person2: I'm not leaving without that tape. Person1: Don't push me, Frank.  I might lose my temper and send it out just for spite.

Person1: We'll sleep here tonight. You'll come home with me. We'll let the house, and the lands too; plenty of willing neighbors. Person2: I don't want to leave. Person1: Didn't want your father to die either, did ya? But it happened.

Person1: I could have my choice of many boyfriends and go to movies and discos but I waste my time waiting for you and then going to stupid pubs. Person2: I'm not a bloody teenager okay, I told you I can't do that shit. Person1: That's it, I am just stupid teenager, yes? Person2: Right now, yeah - you're talking crap.

Person1: Martha, you have to make a decision on her sanity as quickly as possible and not interfere with due process of law. Person2: No... no, excuse me Eve. As quickly as I see fit. Person1: The longer you take to make a decision, the more difficult it will be for us. Person2: Why? Person1: The bishop is breathing down our necks. Person2: And the sooner she goes to prison, the better off she'll be?
Person1: Then say so. Person2: Yes, Addison. Person1: And you realize - you agree how completely you belong to me? Person2: Yes, Addison. Person1: Take your nap, now. And good luck for tonight.

Person1: Don't bullshit me! Don't bullshit me! Person2: You know what I want to hear? I want to hear that you don't love me. If you tell me that, then I'll leave you alone. I won't ask any questions and I won't be in your life.

Person1: Someday you'll have a son just like you, Jeremiah. A boy who lies through his teeth, buys demonic records, and smokes the dope just like you. Person2: If I'm anything like you, I'll deserve him. Person1: What?! Person2: I said, I'm sorry! Person1: If you truly are sorry, son, then you better pray like you've never prayed before. God willed me to find those tickets because He wanted to hear from you.  He knows you need help and He wants you to ask Him for it.
Person1: You don't do what I say... I'll waste you myself. Got it? Person2: Got it...

Person1: Can I come out?  No. Person2: I have to talk to you, alone, J.J., that's why. Person1: You had something to do for me - you didn't do it. Person2: Can I come in for a minute? Person1: No.  You're dead, son - get yourself buried!
Person1: Why are you doing this to me? Person2: I know, Maya, but you'll understand when you see this man.  I really need your strength.
Person1: I'm not crying, Mr. Potter. Person2: Well, you're begging, and that's a whole lot worse. Person1: All I'm asking is thirty days more . . .

Person1: I want you to come home with me right now, Jody. Person2: Who is she? Person1: She's nobody you should be concerned with. Person2: Whoever tried to kill me was made up to look exactly like this picture of Lisa Sherman, clothes and all. I think that concerns me. Person1: Don't make me order you.

Person1: I was sorry to hear about your wife. Person2: Yes ... I got the money. Person1: The President would like to know if that was the last payment. Person2: I'll bet he would. Person1: Is it? Person2: In Richard Nixon's long history of underhanded dealings, he has never gotten better value for his money.  If I were to open my mouth, all the dominoes would fall.

Person1: This is a war, Wade. You against him. Time for vengeance. The City's just in the way. Take him down. You and me. We'll work things out when the time is right. Person2: Remember my promise. Person1: Don't threaten me.  I tend to take these things seriously.  And get a couple hours sleep.  You look like day old shit. Person2: You really have a way with words, don't you?

Person1: She's got information inside of her.  I need you to get it out. Person2: No.  No way.  I wouldn't even know where to begin!  Those thoughts about my cousin Elena -- they were just thoughts. I would never -- Person1: C'mon, Rufus, you've been busted twice for felony hacking. Person2: So? Person1: So now I need you to hack into her.
Person1: I'm sorry.  Would you like a taste? Person2: No, I'm good. Person1: I insist. It's delicious. Just a taste.
Person1: Icarus? Person2: I promise, my dear, I will give the matter some consideration. Person1: Consideration? Person2: If you honestly trust me, then you'll have to trust me.

Person1: Instead of worryin' about Reggie, you better worry about me... Person2: Don't give me this, we were partners. Person1: Billy, go ahead, break it... Person2: No! Don't kill her.  I can get you the money. Person1: When? Person2: I can't get it until Monday. Honest. Person1: You chickenshit punk... Person2: Honest. The place we stashed it opens Monday morning. I can't get it till then. Monday morning, that's when it opens. After that, I'll get the money to you right away...

Person1: Now you've got to promise me faithfully you'll remain true to me forever. Then you'll see how tenderly your little birdie will love you. Person2: I can't wait. Person1: Well, promise then. Person2: What do you mean - now? Person1: Of course now. Right away, before I get any older.
